t: Proverbs 14
The*pn wise woman builds her house, But*ld the foolish pulls it down with her hands.
He*ln who walks in his uprightness fears the Lord,*s But*ld he*i who*i is*i perverse in his ways despises Him.
In*ln the mouth of a fool is*i a rod of pride, But*ld the lips of the wise will preserve them.
Where*ln no oxen are,*i the trough is*i clean; But*ld much increase comes*i by the strength of an ox.
A*ln faithful witness does not lie, But*ld a false witness will utter lies.
A*ln scoffer seeks wisdom and does not find*i it,*i But*ld knowledge is*i easy to him who understands.
Go*ld from the presence of a foolish man, When*ld you do not perceive in*i him*i the lips of knowledge.
The*ln wisdom of the prudent is*i to understand his way, But*ld the folly of fools is*i deceit.
Fools*ln mock at sin, But*ld among the upright there*i is*i favor.
The*ln heart knows its own bitterness, And*ld a stranger does not share its joy.
The*ln house of the wicked will be overthrown, But*ld the tent of the upright will flourish.
There*ln is a way that*i seems*i right to a man, But*ld its end is*i the way of death.
Even*ln in laughter the heart may sorrow, And*ld the end of mirth may*i be*i grief.
The*ln backslider in heart will be filled with his own ways, But*ld a good man will*i be*i satisfied*i from above.
The*ln simple believes every word, But*ld the prudent considers well his steps.
A*ld wise man*i fears and departs from evil, But*ld a fool rages and is self-confident.
A*ld quick-tempered man*i acts foolishly, And*ld a man of wicked intentions is hated.
The*ld simple inherit folly, But*ld the prudent are crowned with knowledge.
The*ld evil will bow before the good, And*ld the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
The*ln poor man*i is hated even by his own neighbor, But*ld the rich has*i many friends.
He*ld who despises his neighbor sins; But*ld he who has mercy on the poor, happy is*i he.
Do*ln they not go astray who devise evil? But*ld mercy and truth belong*i to those who devise good.
In*ln all labor there is profit, But*ld idle chatter leads*i only to poverty.
The*ln crown of the wise is their riches, But*ild the foolishness of fools is*i folly.
A*ln true witness delivers souls, But*ld a deceitful witness*i speaks lies.
In*ln the fear of the Lord*s there*i is*i strong confidence, And*ld His children will have a place of refuge.
The*ld fear of the Lord*s is*i a fountain of life, To*ld turn one*i away from the snares of death.
In*ln a multitude of people is*i a king’s honor, But*ld in the lack of people is*i the downfall of a prince.
He*iln who*i is*i slow to wrath has great understanding, But*ld he*i who*i is*i impulsive exalts folly.
A*ln sound heart is*i life to the body, But*ld envy is*i rottenness to the bones.
He*ln who oppresses the poor reproaches his Maker, But*ld he who honors Him has mercy on the needy.
The*ln wicked is banished in his wickedness, But*ld the righteous has a refuge in his death.
Wisdom*ln rests in the heart of him who has understanding, But*ld what*i is*i in the heart of fools is made known.
Righteousness*ln exalts a nation, But*ld sin is*i a reproach to any*i people.
The*ln king’s favor is*i toward a wise servant, But*ld his wrath is*i against*i him who causes shame.
